template.description: This template is an example flow to demonstrate the capabilities to process and route CSV data. It grabs sample CSV data via HTTP. Then ensures it has a proper header and puts it to the local file system. Then in a disjoint flow the file is picked back up and processed by RouteText to group the data lines by gender and route only those to Kafka.
template.name: Get CSV data validate it and route to Kafka

value.description: The input directory from which files to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Indicates whether to list files from subdirectories of the directory
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: Known Brokers

value.description: The Kafka Topic of interest
value.name: Topic Name

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.
The <Partition> property will be used to determine the partition. All messages within the same FlowFile will be assigned to the same partition.

value.description: Specifies how messages should be partitioned when sent to Kafka
value.name: Partition Strategy

value.description: Specifies which Kafka Partition to add the message to. If using a message delimiter, all messages in the same FlowFile will be sent to the same partition. If a partition is specified but is not valid, then all messages within the same FlowFile will use the same partition but it remains undefined which partition is used.
value.name: Partition

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: Kafka Key

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka
value.name: Delivery Guarantee

value.description: Specifies the delimiter to use for splitting apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. Note that if messages are delimited and some messages for a given FlowFile are transferred successfully while others are not, the messages will be split into individual FlowFiles, such that those messages that were successfully sent are routed to the 'success' relationship while other messages are sent to the 'failure' relationship.
value.name: Message Delimiter

value.description: The maximum amount of data to buffer in memory before sending to Kafka
value.name: Max Buffer Size

value.description: The maximum size that any individual record can be.
value.name: Max Record Size

value.description: The amount of time to wait for a response from Kafka before determining that there is a communications error
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: The number of messages to send in one batch. The producer will wait until either this number of messages are ready to send or "Queue Buffering Max Time" is reached.
value.name: Async Batch Size

value.description: Maximum time to buffer data before sending to Kafka. For example a setting of 100 ms will try to batch together 100 milliseconds' worth of messages to send at once. This will improve throughput but adds message delivery latency due to the buffering.
value.name: Queue Buffering Max Time

allowableValues.description: Compression will not be used for any topic.
Compress messages using GZIP
Compress messages using Snappy

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: Compression Codec

value.description: Client Name to use when communicating with Kafka
value.name: Client Name

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

config.comments: The CSV Data coming from randomuser.me contains a header line but does not have a # on the beginning. This Processor adds the # to the beginning of the first line.

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

value.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS). Arbitrary methods are also supported but will be sent without a message body.
value.name: HTTP Method

value.description: Remote URL which will be connected to, including scheme, host, port, path.
value.name: Remote URL

value.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL (https) connections.
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Max wait time for connection to remote service.
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: Max wait time for response from remote service.
value.name: Read Timeout

value.description: Include an RFC-2616 Date header in the request.
value.name: Include Date Header

value.description: Follow HTTP redirects issued by remote server.
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers. Also any dynamic properties set will be sent as headers. The dynamic property key will be the header key and the dynamic property value will be interpreted as expression language will be the header value.
value.name: Attributes to Send

value.description: The username to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL. Cannot include control characters (0-31), ':', or DEL (127).
value.name: Basic Authentication Username

value.description: The password to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.
value.name: Basic Authentication Password

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

value.description: If set, the response body received back will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.
value.name: Put Response Body In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: If routing the response body to an attribute of the original (by setting the "Put response body in attribute" property or by receiving an error status code), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: Whether to communicate with the website using Digest Authentication. 'Basic Authentication Username' and 'Basic Authentication Password' are used for authentication.
value.name: Digest Authentication

value.description: Will force a response FlowFile to be generated and routed to the 'Response' relationship regardless of what the server status code received is or if the processor is configured to put the server response body in the request attribute. In the later configuration a request FlowFile with the response body in the attribute and a typical response FlowFile will be emitted to their respective relationships.
value.name: Always Output Response

value.description: Bypass the normal truststore hostname verifier to allow the specified remote hostname as trusted. Enabling this property has MITM security implications, use wisely. Will still accept other connections based on the normal truststore hostname verifier. Only valid with SSL (HTTPS) connections.
value.name: Trusted Hostname

value.description: Enabling this property saves all the response headers to the original request. This may be when the response headers are needed but a response is not generated due to the status code received.
value.name: Add Response Headers to Request

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception. It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: No Retry

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the success of the request.
relationships.name: Original

relationships.description: A Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). If the 'Output Response Regardless' property is true then the response will be sent to this relationship regardless of the status code received.
relationships.name: Response

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Retry

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The fully-qualified filename of the file to fetch from the file system
value.name: File to Fetch

allowableValues.description: Leave the file as-is
Moves the file to the directory specified by the <Move Destination Directory> property
Deletes the original file from the file system

value.description: Specifies what to do with the original file on the file system once it has been pulled into NiFi
value.name: Completion Strategy

value.description: The directory to the move the original file to once it has been fetched from the file system. This property is ignored unless the Completion Strategy is set to "Move File". If the directory does not exist, it will be created.
value.name: Move Destination Directory

allowableValues.description: The existing destination file should remain intact. The newly ingested file should be moved to the destination directory but be renamed to a random filename
The newly ingested file should replace the existing file in the Destination Directory
The existing file should in the Destination Directory should stay intact and the newly ingested file should be deleted
The existing destination file should remain intact and the incoming FlowFile should be routed to failure

value.description: If Completion Strategy is set to Move File and a file already exists in the destination directory with the same name, this property specifies how that naming conflict should be resolved
value.name: Move Conflict Strategy

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the file system for any reason other than insufficient permissions or the file not existing will be transferred to this Relationship.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the file system because the file could not be found will be transferred to this Relationship.
relationships.name: not.found

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the file system due to the user running NiFi not having sufficient permissions will be transferred to this Relationship.
relationships.name: permission.denied

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully fetched from the file system will be transferred to this Relationship.
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: Lines will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
allowableValues.displayName: Route to each matching Property Name
allowableValues.value: Route to each matching Property Name

allowableValues.description: Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the line to be considered a match
allowableValues.displayName: Route to 'matched' if line matches all conditions
allowableValues.value: Route to 'matched' if line matches all conditions

allowableValues.description: Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for the line to be considered a match
allowableValues.displayName: Route to 'matched' if lines matches any condition
allowableValues.value: Route to 'matched' if lines matches any condition

value.defaultValue: Route to each matching Property Name
value.description: Specifies how to determine which Relationship(s) to use when evaluating the lines of incoming text against the 'Matching Strategy' and user-defined properties.
value.name: Routing Strategy

allowableValues.description: Match lines based on whether the line starts with the property value
Match lines based on whether the line ends with the property value
Match lines based on whether the line contains the property value
Match lines based on whether the line equals the property value
Match lines based on whether the line exactly matches the Regular Expression that is provided as the Property value
Match lines based on whether the line contains some text that matches the Regular Expression that is provided as the Property value

value.description: Specifies how to evaluate each line of incoming text against the user-defined properties.
value.name: Matching Strategy

value.description: The Character Set in which the incoming text is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Indicates whether or not the whitespace at the beginning and end of the lines should be ignored when evaluating the line.
value.name: Ignore Leading/Trailing Whitespace

value.description: If true, capitalization will not be taken into account when comparing values. E.g., matching against 'HELLO' or 'hello' will have the same result.
value.name: Ignore Case

value.description: Specifies a Regular Expression to evaluate against each line to determine which Group the line should be placed in. The Regular Expression must have at least one Capturing Group that defines the line's Group. If multiple Capturing Groups exist in the Regular Expression, the Group from all Capturing Groups. Two lines will not be placed into the same FlowFile unless the they both have the same value for the Group (or neither line matches the Regular Expression). For example, to group together all lines in a CSV File by the first column, we can set this value to "(.*?),.*". Two lines that have the same Group but different Relationships will never be placed into the same FlowFile.
value.name: Grouping Regular Expression

entry.value: Route to each matching Property Name

relationships.description: The original input file will be routed to this destination when the lines have been successfully routed to 1 or more relationships
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: Data that does not satisfy the required user-defined rules will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: unmatched
